title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Goldman Sachs plans to fold its biggest businesses into three divisions, undertaking one of the biggest reshuffles in the Wall Street firm's history.

Three senior KFC executives gave notice that they will retire at the end of November as rising interest rates threaten to reduce lump-sum payouts for corporate pensions.

Activist investor Starboard has a sizable stake in Splunk and plans to push the software maker to take action to boost its stock price, according to people familiar with the matter.

Grocery giant Kroger is pausing share buybacks ahead of its planned acquisition of rival Albertsons, aiming to use the additional cash to reduce its debt.

P&G, Netflix and Tesla highlight a busy coming week of earnings as persistent inflation and climbing interest rates stoke talk of a recession.

SPAC sponsors made profits while investors in the businesses brought to market experienced significant losses as the blank-check-company boom fizzled in recent years.

What's News: Business & Finance
